intro: Dorycnium pentaphyllum subsp. lagunae, commonly known as the lake burr, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a creeping rootstock and produces elongated, beak-like pods that contain small, rounded seeds. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in coastal and inland wetlands. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
